Seven children living in van in Denver taken from couple
The Denver Department of Human Services this week took seven children from a homeless couple that were living out of their van. Housekeys Action Network Denver, or HAND, shared the story last month of Rehema Cranmer, her partner and their seven children. HAND explained in a statement that the family had to “play Tetris” to fit into the van. People read the article and donated to a fund to buy Cranmer’s family a new van, which they recently acquired, according to HAND.

What Happens If You Help An Undocumented Immigrant?
With ramped-up immigration crackdowns and deportations since January, what rights do Americans have to help undocumented immigrants?. The major federal law codifying U.S. provisions concerning this — the Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952 (INA) — prohibits harboring unauthorized immigrants, but there is no nationwide, Supreme Court consensus as to what harboring means.

Dianna Carney
Meet The Little Dog Who Survived His Entire Life on the Streets Now Looking For a Loving Family
Great Dog Rescue New England, a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, recently introduced Nemo, a charming one-year-old Cairn Terrier and Cattle Dog mix who is patiently waiting for his forever family to come find him. Nemo's journey began when he was born to stray parents. Though it is unclear how he spent his early life living on the streets, he was eventually brought into Great Dog Rescue New England’s care alongside three others who were also born to other strays. Now living with a Northern foster family, Nemo is finally learning what it means to be loved and have a home. His forever home, however, is still something he has not found.

One Dead From Brain-Eating Parasite at a Texas Campground. How to Stay Safe.
A 71-year-old woman died last month after contracting Naegleria fowleri—the rare amoeba that destroys brain tissue—while staying at an RV park in Texas. Investigators say she rinsed her sinuses with unboiled tap water from the RV’s plumbing, then developed fatal primary amebic meningoencephalitis (PAM) eight days later.

Meet the Gentle Dog Left to Starve by the Only Family He Ever Knew Now Looking for Love
Sandy Paws Rescue Inc., a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, recently introduced Dutch, a gentle dog whose story touches hearts and shows the resilience of rescue dogs. Despite a challenging past marked by abandonment, Dutch has maintained an unwavering spirit and gentle demeanor. "This sweet, pajama-wearing gentleman was abandoned by the only family he'd ever known, left outside to starve when they no longer wanted him," shares the local nonprofit rescue, highlighting the unfortunate circumstances that brought Dutch into their care. Yet, what makes Dutch's story remarkable is not the hardship he endured, but rather his continued capacity for love and trust despite all he has been through.

Undocumented Man in NJ Fraudulently Gains Custody of Migrant Child
ORANGE, NJ - A Guatemalan national residing unlawfully in the United States has been charged with submitting false sponsorship applications to the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) in a scheme to gain custody of two unaccompanied alien children, federal authorities announced. The charges were filed in a federal complaint on May 14, 2025, by U.S. Attorney Alina Habba and Attorney General Pam Bondi.

Meet The Young Dog Rescued From Under Storage Containers With 9 Puppies
Sandy Paws Rescue Inc., a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, recently introduced Kenya, a resilient mother dog whose journey from abandonment to hope truly highlights the transformative power of rescue organizations. Living pregnant and alone, Kenya had sought refuge beneath outdoor storage containers, where she gave birth to eight puppies known as the "Lion King" litter. Lucky for all 9 pups, a rescuer discovered the family and brought them all to safety. "Kenya LOVES people and wants to say hi to everyone," shares the rescue organization, highlighting her remarkably friendly disposition despite her challenging past.

Unveiling the Pink Illusion: The Truth Behind the Strawberry Moon
Despite the convincing photographs, the Strawberry Moon, with its captivating beauty, graces the sky during the transition period between spring and summer, in late May or early June. This first full moon of the year, the Strawberry Moon, heralds the arrival of summer. Occasionally, it aligns with the summer solstice, a rare event that marks the day with the longest duration of sunlight throughout the year.

Five Amtrak Employees Guilty in $11M Healthcare Fraud
MORRIS COUNTY, NJ - Five current and former Amtrak employees have pleaded guilty in federal court to participating in a multi-million-dollar health care fraud conspiracy that resulted in over $11 million in fraudulent claims paid by Amtrak’s health insurance plan. U.S. Attorney Alina Habba announced the guilty pleas, which were entered before U.S. District Judge Madeline Cox Arleo in Newark.
